overview:
David S. Brooks is an entrepreneurial business executive with more than 25 years of corporate communications, marketing, and investor relations experience.

Brooks is currently Vice President of client services for Health Platforms, Inc. and co-founder of PracticeBrain, Inc., the healthcare software company it acquired in January 2012.
Brooks is a partner with Optimal Conversions, Inc., a NY-based web strategy and marketing firm he co-founded in 2009, and owner of SPS Group, a corporate communications consulting firm he founded in 2007.

Prior to Optimal Conversions and SPS, Brooks was Vice President, Marketing & Sales for DWIN Electronics, a manufacturer of high-definition plasma displays and digital video projectors for home theater.

Brooks also served as director, investor relations & corporate communications for UNOVA, Inc., (NYSE:IN), a $1B industrial technology company. During his tenure, Mr. Brooks’ developed an investor relations campaign that helped increase market capitalization by 625% and trading liquidity from 50,000 to 500,000 shares/day.

Earlier in his career, Brooks worked as global marketing communications manager for a division of Warner-Lambert Company, and held senior management positions with public relations agencies for Mobil Chemical, BASF and International Paper.

Brooks graduated from the State University of New York with a Bachelor’s degree in Rhetoric & Communications, and the University of Southern California with an MBA.
